With the passage of #HR8 and #HR1112 in the House, we are taking action to #EndGunViolence by expanding #BackgroundChecks.

I am hopeful that the era of complacency in the face of gun violence is coming to an end.

#EnoughIsEnough @bradybuzz

#OTD in 1981, WH Press Sec James Brady was shot in the head & paralyzed for life in an assassination attempt on President Reagan. The President & 2 officers were also shot.

Brady dedicated his life to passing the #BradyBill - the 1st federal background check bill for gun sales. pic.twitter.com/elDun2zA8P

ICYMI: the House affirms that women deserve #EqualPayforEqualWork. Proud to vote YES on H.R. 7 and show my support for fellow hard working women. pic.twitter.com/R4HoQhPP9x

I came to Congress to protect Georgians with pre-existing conditions and to make healthcare more affordable. 

Proud to have joined @HouseDemocrats yesterday in taking a major step to #ProtectOurCare

Two tragedies, after countless others, brought us to today. My son was torn from my life. An act of gun violence took 17 lives in Parkland.

We will keep fighting to keep our communities safe.

I pray that a year from now we can look back on the progress we‚Äôve made. pic.twitter.com/1QlErdm85C

#YourComplacencyKillsUs pic.twitter.com/mnulfO9xNc

The #ACA provides protections for the 130 million people w/ pre-existing conditions, including over 4 million Georgians.

As a two-time cancer survivor, I know how important it is that we protect Americans with pre-existing conditions, expand coverage, & lower health care costs.

Nine years ago, the Affordable Care Act (#ACA) was signed into law.

Since then, more than 20 million uninsured Americans have gained quality, affordable health insurance coverage.

#ACAanniversary pic.twitter.com/AVMaaRjrDK
